caption:
Different US Cities and Their Respective Industry Focus
 
Cities in the US are so different in culture from each other that if you want to do business with US clients, you have to understand what they would prioritize…
 
For example, New York does not care about startups, what it cares about is finance, media and fashion. If you’re in NY, the way to win is to understand global financial markets and be extremely fashionable to fit in… (It has seen 85% growth in fintech investments over the past 3 years)
 
Boston, on the other hand, is quite the opposite. It’s all about building businesses that are built on long term vision, patient capital, and years of research like in Biotechnology and in AI. To win here, you have to belong to a top educational institute… (They’ve had over USD 8 Bn invested in Biotech just last year)
 
While San Francisco would be known as the Startup Capital, Austin is now the fastest growing tech hub with companies like Tesla and Oracle moving here, and new tech founders are willing to come here instead. They all prioritize growth over profitability.
 
By comparison, Chicago startups reach profitability much faster and are more profit conscious.
 
LA’s focus is on media tech and gaming, clearly with its links to Hollywood. If you’re building something in the creator economy, this is where you come.
 
And if you wish to build in Crypto or focus on the Latin American market, you come down and build in Miami.
 
As for Seattle, go there is you work in Microsoft or Amazon. There is absolutely no other reason to be there.
 
#casarthakahuja
